member.name: P:C1.C1Preview.RenderBarCode.BarCodeType
member.summary:
Gets or sets the type of encoding to use when generating the barcode.
Note that BarCodeType.None is not a valid value for this property.
member.remarks: The selected encoding is applied to the value stored in the property to generate the barcode image displayed in the object.

member.name: P:C1.C1Preview.RenderBarCode.ShowText
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the string represending the property should be displayed along with the barcode image.
member.remarks: By default, the object will show only the barcode image. To include a textual representation of the value in the property, set this property to true.

member.name: P:C1.C1Preview.RenderBarCode.Text
member.summary: Gets or sets the value that is encoded as the barcode image.

remarks.para: Some encodings support alphanumeric values of any length. Others are limited to numeric values or to a specific set of characters. See the enumeration for details.
If you use characters that are invalid for the current encoding, the object will display a blank image.

member.summary: Converts a string to a UnitTypeEnum value. The string can be one of the following: "def", "doc", "in", "mm", "pc", "pix", "pt", "tw", "inhs". This method is case-insensitive.

On exit, contains the UnitTypeEnum value.
member.returns: Returns true if no error occurs, false otherwise.

member.summary:
Converts a UnitTypeEnum value to the string representation.
DefaultEmpty string
Document"doc"
Inch"in"
Millimeter"mm"
Pica"pc"
Pixel"pix"
Point"pt"
Twip"tw"
InHs"inhs"
member.param: Value to convert.

member.name: T:C1.C1Preview.AnchorEnum
member.summary: Determines how a is positioned with respect to its containing section when the section grows or shrinks as a result of the section's
member.remarks: Use members of this enumeration to set the value of the property in the class.

member.name: F:C1.C1Preview.AnchorEnum.Top
member.summary: The field does not move. The space between the top of the field and the top of the section remains the same.

member.name: F:C1.C1Preview.AnchorEnum.Bottom
member.summary: The field moves vertically. The space between the bottom of the field and the bottom of the section remains the same.

member.name: F:C1.C1Preview.AnchorEnum.TopAndBottom
member.summary: The field grows or shrinks with the section. Both the distance from the top of the field to the top of the section, and the distance from the bottom of the field to the bottom of the section, remain the same.

member.name: T:C1.C1Preview.RenderField
member.summary: Represents a field of a . Objects of this type are created when a is imported into a .

member.name: P:C1.C1Preview.RenderField.TabPositions
member.summary: Gets the collection of text tab positions.

member.name: P:C1.C1Preview.RenderField.HasTabPositions
member.summary: Gets the value indicating whether the collection contains at least one element.

member.name: P:C1.C1Preview.RenderField.Text
member.summary: Gets or sets the text of the current field.

remarks.para: This property contains the text that will be rendered on the document.
This value may be rendered literally (without any translation) or it may be evaluated as a script expression, depending on the value of the property.

member.name: P:C1.C1Preview.RenderField.Picture
member.summary:
Gets or sets a picture to display in the current field.
This property may be set to one of the following three kinds of objects:
A regular .NET object.
A string containing an image file name or URL.
A string containing the name of an image field in the data source.
The first two options are used to create unbound images, such as logos. These images do not depend on the document data.
The third option is used to create bound images, such as product or employee pictures. These images are stored with the document data.

member.name: P:C1.C1Preview.RenderField.DetectUrls
member.summary: If the current field's property is true, this property gets or sets a value indicating whether Uniform Resource Locators (URLs) will be automatically formatted when found in the text.

member.name: P:C1.C1Preview.RenderField.Calculated
member.summary: Specifies whether the property should be interpreted as a literal value or as a calculated expression.

remarks.para: If this property is set to false, the value of the property is inserted in the document without any further processing.
If this property is set to true, the value of the property is evaluated as a script expression and the result of the expression is inserted in the document.

member.name: P:C1.C1Preview.RenderField.HideDuplicates
member.summary: Specifies whether duplicate values in consecutive records should be suppressed.

remarks.para: You can use the property to hide a field in a document when its value is the same as in the preceding record.
For example, in a report listing suppliers and their products, each supplier's name can appear just once for each group of products, rather than repeat for each product.

member.name: P:C1.C1Preview.RenderField.Format
member.summary: Gets or sets a string used to format the value of the current field.

remarks.para: You can use this property to customize the way numbers, dates, times, and text are displayed and printed.
For example, if you've created a Price field, you can set its property to "Currency". If the field value is set to "4321.678", it would be rendered as $4,321.68.
You can use this property to format numbers (including currency and percentage values), dates, boolean values, and strings.
The syntax for the format string is the same used with the .NET method.

member.name: P:C1.C1Preview.RenderField.LineSlant
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether a line should be drawn across the current field (as opposed to a box around the field).
member.remarks: The color, style, and thickness of the line are determined by the property.

member.name: P:C1.C1Preview.RenderField.CheckBox
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the current field should be displayed as a checkbox.
member.remarks: This property allows you to display boolean values graphically, rather than as plain text.

member.name: P:C1.C1Preview.RenderField.RTF
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether of the current field should be interpreted as RTF.

member.name: P:C1.C1Preview.RenderField.BarCodeType
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the current field should be rendered as barcode, and allows to specifiy the barcode type.

member.name: P:C1.C1Preview.RenderField.GeneralTextAlignment
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the text alignment in the current field should depend on the type of data represented by the field. If this property is true, numbers will align to the right while all other data to the left.

member.name: P:C1.C1Preview.RenderField.HidePicture
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the image should not be displayed, works like PictureScaleEnum.Hide.

member.name: P:C1.C1Preview.RenderField.SubReport
member.summary: Gets or sets a reference to a object to be rendered within the current field.

member.name: P:C1.C1Preview.RenderField.CanGrow
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the height of the current field can increase automatically to fit the field's content.

member.name: P:C1.C1Preview.RenderField.CanShrink
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the height of the current field can decrease automatically to fit the field's content.

member.name: P:C1.C1Preview.RenderField.Anchor
member.summary: Gets or sets the value determining the vertical position of the current field relative to the containing .

remarks.para: Normally, fields do not move when sections grow or shrink. In some cases, however, you may want fields to grow with the section or to stay in the same position relative to the bottom of the section.
This is especially common for fields used to create vertical lines that should extend the entire height of the section.

member.name: F:C1.C1Preview.SplitParams.ContentSplitOffset
member.summary: OUT (FindSplitPos): Offsets for split position within content area, the content area is split at position: RealSplitPos - ContentSplitOffset. ContentSplitOffset calculated on the base of padding / spacing / borders / RepeatBorders.

member.name: F:C1.C1Preview.SplitParams.ContentRealSplitPos
member.summary: OUT (FindSplitPos): The real split position within content area, calculated in the FindVertSplitPosContent / FindHorzSplitPosContent. ContentRealSplitPos = RealSplitPos - ContentSplitOffset. Also see comments to ReprintedFooterSize.

member.name: F:C1.C1Preview.SplitParams.ChildrenSplitPosOffset
member.summary: OUT (FindSplitPos): Offset of children' splitting position from ContentSplitPos.

member.name: F:C1.C1Preview.SplitParams.ReprintFooterSize
member.summary: OUT (FindSplitPos): The size of reprinted footer at the bottom of object, filled in the FindXXXContent method, after calling this method the ContentRealSplitPos does not include this size, and real RealSplitPos is: ContentRealSplitPos + ContentSplitOffset + ReprintFooterSize.

member.name: T:C1.C1Preview.GrowShrinkModeEnum
member.summary: Specifies the logic for handling CanGrow/CanShrink fields.
member.remarks: Use the members of this enumeration to set the value of the property in the class.

member.name: F:C1.C1Preview.GrowShrinkModeEnum.C1Report
member.summary: Uses the standard C1Report mode, where fields that grow or shrink affect only fields directly below.

member.name: F:C1.C1Preview.GrowShrinkModeEnum.Access
member.summary: Uses a mode that is similar to MS Access, where fields that grow or shrink affect all fields below, even if they are off to the side of the field that grew or shrank.

member.name: T:C1.C1Preview.RenderReport
member.summary: Represents a sub-report (a C1Report contained within a and specified by its property).

member.summary: Represents a general-purpose container for render objects.

member.name: P:C1.C1Preview.RenderArea.HeaderVert
member.summary: Gets or sets a render object that will be repeated on all pages (or columns) if the current render area is split vertically when it is too high to fit on a single page.
member.remarks: The specified render object should not be a child of another render object. It can be a child of the current render area; if it is not, it will be added to the current render area's collection.

member.name: P:C1.C1Preview.RenderArea.HeaderHorz
member.summary: Gets or sets a render object that will be repeated on all "horizontal" pages if the current render area is split horizontally when it is too wide to fit on a single page.
member.remarks: The specified render object should not be a child of another render object. It can be a child of the current render area; if it is not, it will be added to the current render area's collection.

member.name: P:C1.C1Preview.RenderReport.ExposeScriptObjects
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether script objects should be exposed to nested objects.

member.name: P:C1.C1Preview.RenderReport.DataProcessingStartingScript
member.summary: Gets or sets a script that is executed when data processing of the current object starts.

member.name: P:C1.C1Preview.RenderReport.DataProcessingFinishedScript
member.summary: Gets or sets a script that is executed when data processing of the current object has completed.

member.name: P:C1.C1Preview.RenderReport.GrowShrinkMode
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating how and properties are handled.

remarks.para: If this property is set to , fields with or properties set to true will move fields directly below them when they grow or shrink. Fields located below but off to the side are not moved.

If this property is set to , fields that grow or shrink will affect all fields below, even those which are not directly under the field that was modified as a result of CanGrow/CanShrink. (This is the Microsoft Access behavior.)
For example, if fields are arranged in a grid layout and is set to , fields within each row will remain vertically aligned when fields above them grow or shrink.
If is set to , fields within each column will move independently of fields in other columns, and fields within each row will not remain vertically aligned.

member.summary: Gets or sets a string containig the script to be executed before the current section is printed (after it has been formatted). This script can be used to adjust the visual properties of the section which do not affect the layout (e.g. text and background colors).

member.summary: Returns the index of string in array of strings. Search is case sensitive.

String to search.
member.returns: Index of string in array of -1.

member.name: M:C1.C1Preview.Utils.TryParseInt(System.String,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Converts the string representation of a number to its 32-bit signed integer equivalent. A return value indicates whether the operation succeeded. This functions uses FloatFormatInfo as format provider.
member.param: A string containing a number to convert.

When this method returns, contains the 32-bit signed integer value equivalent to the number contained in s, if the conversion succeeded, or zero if the conversion failed. The conversion fails if the s parameter is null, is not of the correct format, or represents a number less than MinValue or greater than MaxValue. This parameter is passed uninitialized.
member.returns: true if s was converted successfully; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:C1.C1Preview.Utils.TryParseDouble(System.String,System.Double@)
member.summary: Converts the string representation of a number to its double-precision floating-point number equivalent. A return value indicates whether the conversion succeeded or failed. This functions uses FloatFormatInfo as format provider.
member.param: A string containing a number to convert.

When this method returns, contains a double-precision floating-point number equivalent to the numeric value or symbol contained in s, if the conversion succeeded, or zero if the conversion failed. The conversion fails if the s parameter is null, is not in a format compliant with style, represents a number less than MinValue or greater than MaxValue, or if style is not a valid combination of NumberStyles enumerated constants. This parameter is passed uninitialized.
member.returns: true if s was converted successfully; otherwise, false.

member.name: T:C1.C1Preview.C1PrintController
member.summary: The .NET PreviewPrintController creates metafiles with gdi+ commands. This is bad for us because the format of such emf records is not documented, and so we can not e.g. search for text. But, if we just use .NET PrintController, the page generation process slows down by a factor of 2 (at least). The only way to avoid this is to inherit from PreviewPrintController but provide our own graphics, based on emf-only metafiles. Another caveat is which base methods to call and which not. Invoking base.OnStartPrint/base.OnEndPrint is necessary because if we do not do that performance is the same as with the regular PrintController (i.e. bad). OTOH, invoking base.OnStartPage/ base.OnEndPage looks like wasting time (as we can not use the provided graphics anyway) and what is more, for big documents at some point seems to drain resources and causes our creation of metailes to fail. So what is below seems to be the only combination that works. Still, the whole printing stuff in .NET is a mess. --dima.

member.name: P:C1.C1Preview.C1PrintDocument.AllowNonReflowableDocs
member.summary: Gets or sets the value indicating whether methods can be called on the document that would result in the document becoming non-reflowable. If false (the default), invoking such methods causes an exception to be thrown. (If the document is non-reflowable, the document will not automatically reflow in the preview when the end user changes page settings.)

member.name: P:C1.C1Preview.C1PrintDocument.ClipPage
member.summary: Gets or sets the value indicating whether to clip the content to page margins. The default value is true.

member.name: P:C1.C1Preview.C1PrintDocument.DisableUserReflow
member.summary: Gets or sets the value indicating whether the end user should be allowed to reflow the document with different page settings. This value is only a hint to the document viewer, it is the viewer's responsibility to respect that hint.

member.name: P:C1.C1Preview.C1PrintDocument.UseGdiPlusTextRendering
member.summary: Gets or sets the value indicating whether all text in the current document should be rendered using the GDI+ text API.

member.name: P:C1.C1Preview.C1PrintDocument.DoEvents
member.summary: Specifies whether should handle Windows messages while generating the document.

remarks.para: Setting this property to true allows users to resize forms, click buttons, etc. while documents are being generated. This makes applications more responsive, and is necessary if you want to provide a "Cancel" button to stop the document generation (otherwise the user wouldn't be able to click the button until the generation was complete).
Setting this property to false will cause documents to generate slightly faster.

example.para: The code below implements "Generate" and "Cancel" buttons attached to a .

The "Generate" button checks whether the document is busy before starting to generate it. This is necessary because the user could click the "Generate" button several times in a row, before the document got a chance to finish generating. (Calling the method while the component is busy throws an exception.)
The "Cancel" button checks whether the document is currently generating, and sets the property to true if it is.

member.name: P:C1.C1Preview.C1PrintDocument.CurrentPageLayout
member.summary:
Gets the effective layout for the current page. That layout is automatically built on the fly by merging all applicable layouts defined for the document in . You may change the properties on CurrentPageLayout programmatically. The changes will be effective immediately if they are made in the event handler, otherwise they will take effect for the next added page.
Note that this property is only available during document generation, at other times null is returned.

member.name: P:C1.C1Preview.C1PrintDocument.DocumentDirectoryName
member.summary: Gets the directory of the .

member.name: P:C1.C1Preview.C1PrintDocument.DocumentStartingScript
member.summary: Gets or sets the script that is executed when the current document starts generating.

remarks.para: also fires the event at this time.

The difference between events and scripts is that event handlers belong to the application code, while scripts belong to the document. Thus it is recommended that event handlers be used to perform tasks that implement the overall application logic but do not depend on the specific document being processed.

On the other hand, scripts should be used to perform tasks directly related to the document itself. Scripts attached to a document are executed regardless of the current application (e.g. when the document is regenerated after being loaded from file by a different program). (For example, a document might contain a script that changes the value of a field in that document when an error occurs.)

member.name: P:C1.C1Preview.C1PrintDocument.DocumentEndedScript
member.summary: Gets or sets the script that is executed when the current document has finished generating.

remarks.para: also fires the event at this time.

The difference between events and scripts is that event handlers belong to the application code, while scripts belong to the document. Thus it is recommended that event handlers be used to perform tasks that implement the overall application logic but do not depend on the specific document being processed.

On the other hand, scripts should be used to perform tasks directly related to the document itself. Scripts attached to a document are executed regardless of the current application (e.g. when the document is regenerated after being loaded from file by a different program). (For example, a document might contain a script that changes the value of a field in that document when an error occurs.)

member.name: P:C1.C1Preview.C1PrintDocument.PageConfigureScript
member.summary:
Gets or sets the script that is executed when a new page is added to the document. This script executes after the page has been added to the collection but before it is resolved (i.e. when the content of the page has not been laid out yet).
This script should be used only to change the page layout. Do not use this script to change the page content, as it may cause errors.

remarks.para: also fires the event at this time.

The difference between events and scripts is that event handlers belong to the application code, while scripts belong to the document. Thus it is recommended that event handlers be used to perform tasks that implement the overall application logic but do not depend on the specific document being processed.

On the other hand, scripts should be used to perform tasks directly related to the document itself. Scripts attached to a document are executed regardless of the current application (e.g. when the document is regenerated after being loaded from file by a different program). (For example, a document might contain a script that changes the value of a field in that document when an error occurs.)

member.name: P:C1.C1Preview.C1PrintDocument.ErrorScript
member.summary: Gets or sets the script that is executed when an error occurs in a script attached to the document.

remarks.para: also fires the event at this time.

The difference between events and scripts is that event handlers belong to the application code, while scripts belong to the document. Thus it is recommended that event handlers be used to perform tasks that implement the overall application logic but do not depend on the specific document being processed.

On the other hand, scripts should be used to perform tasks directly related to the document itself. Scripts attached to a document are executed regardless of the current application (e.g. when the document is regenerated after being loaded from file by a different program). (For example, a document might contain a script that changes the value of a field in that document when an error occurs.)

member.name: P:C1.C1Preview.C1LinkTargetFile.FileName
member.summary: Specifies the file or object on which to execute the specified verb.
member.remarks: To specify a Shell namespace object, pass the fully qualified parse name. Note that not all verbs are supported on all objects. For example, not all document types support the "print" verb.

member.name: P:C1.C1Preview.C1LinkTargetFile.Command
member.summary: String, referred to in this case as a verb, that specifies the action to be performed.

remarks.para: The set of available verbs depends on the particular file or folder. Generally, the actions available from an object's shortcut menu are available verbs.
For more information about verbs and their availability, see Object Verbs. See Extending Shortcut Menus for further discussion of shortcut menus.
The following verbs are commonly used.

list.item: edit Launches an editor and opens the document for editing. If FileName is not a document file, the function will fail.

item.description: Explores the folder specified by FileName.
Initiates a search starting from the specified directory.
Opens the file specified by the FileName parameter. The file can be an executable file, a document file, or a folder.
Prints the document file specified by FileName. If FileName is not a document file, the function will fail.

For systems prior to Microsoft? Windows? 2000, the default verb is used if it is valid and available in the registry. If not, the "open" verb is used. For Windows 2000 and later systems, the default verb is used if available. If not, the "open" verb is used. If neither verb is available, the system uses the first verb listed in the registry.

member.name: P:C1.C1Preview.C1LinkTargetFile.Parameters
member.summary: If the FileName parameter specifies an executable file, Parameters is a string that specifies the parameters to be passed to the application. The format of this string is determined by the verb that is to be invoked. If FileName specifies a document file, Parameters should be an empty string.

member.summary: Defines table sizing modes.

member.summary: At table level, default is Auto for rows, and Fixed for columns; at row/column level, default inherits from the table.

member.name: F:C1.C1Preview.TableSizingModeEnum.Fixed
member.summary: Size (height for rows, width for columns) should be explicitly specified (if omitted, is determined by the available space and row/column count).

member.name: F:C1.C1Preview.TableSizingModeEnum.Auto
member.summary: Size (height for rows, width for columns) is calculated automatically based on the content.

member.name: T:C1.C1Preview.TableHeaderEnum
member.summary: Defines how the table header is repeated.

member.name: F:C1.C1Preview.TableHeaderEnum.None
member.summary: The header is printed once at the top of the table.

member.name: F:C1.C1Preview.TableHeaderEnum.Page
member.summary: The header is repeated at the top of each page. If there are multiple columns per page, the header is repeated only at the top of the first column on the page.

member.name: F:C1.C1Preview.TableHeaderEnum.Column
member.summary: The header is repeated only if there are multiple columns per page, at the top of each column except the first on the page. If there is only one column, the header is not printed at all.

member.name: F:C1.C1Preview.TableHeaderEnum.All
member.summary: The header is repeated at the top of all pages. If there are multiple columns per page, the header is repeated at the top of each column.

member.name: T:C1.C1Preview.TableFooterEnum
member.summary: Defines how the table footer is repeated.

member.name: F:C1.C1Preview.TableFooterEnum.None
member.summary: The footer is printed once at the end of the table.

member.name: F:C1.C1Preview.TableFooterEnum.Page
member.summary: The footer is repeated at the bottom of each page. If there are multiple columns per page, the footer is repeated only at the bottom of the last column on the page.

member.name: F:C1.C1Preview.TableFooterEnum.Column
member.summary: The footer is repeated only if there are multiple columns per page, at the bottom of each column except the last on the page. If there is only one column, the footer is not printed at all.

member.name: F:C1.C1Preview.TableFooterEnum.All
member.summary: The footer is repeated at the bottom of all pages. If there are multiple columns per page, the footer is repeated at the bottom of each column.

member.name: P:C1.C1Preview.TableVectorGroup.PageFooter
member.summary: Indicates whether the group should be reprinted as footer on each page where table exists. Only one group in the table can has this flag.

member.name: P:C1.C1Preview.TableVectorGroup.ColumnFooter
member.summary: Indicates whether the group should be reprinted as footer on each column where table exists. Only one group in the table can has this flag.

member.name: P:C1.C1Preview.TableVectorGroupCollection.DataBindingMode
member.summary:
Gets the data binding mode. For a collection of TableVectorGroup object this property returns:
None no groups are data bound.
Unsupported at least one group is data bound to an unsupported data source.
List at least one group is data bound, and all data bound groups are bound to supported data sources.

member.name: M:C1.C1Preview.RenderInputBase.IsControlNeededParentForWmPrint
member.summary: This method returns true if underlaying control of RenderInputBase object needs the parent to correctly process the WM_PRINT message. By default the RenderInputBase object returns true.

member.summary: Returns true if selection within parent control should be reset when the underlying control receives an input focus.

member.summary: Creates the underlying windows control object.
member.returns: Returns the created window control object.

member.name: P:C1.C1Preview.RenderInputBase.ReadOnly
member.summary: Gets or sets the value indicating whether the control is read-only. For read-only controls, all input actions are still fired, but the control's value cannot be changed. The default is false.

member.name: P:C1.C1Preview.RenderInputBase.Printable
member.summary: Gets or sets the value indicating whether the control is printed. If true (default), the content of the control is printed normally. Otherwise, it is not printed or exported. This might be used for example to provide help for fields that are to be filled.

member.summary: Gets or sets the text.

member.summary: View continuous pages.

member.summary: View facing pages.

member.name: F:C1.C1Preview.DocumentActionEnum.PageFacingContinuous
member.summary: View continuous facing pages.

member.name: F:C1.C1Preview.DocumentActionEnum.GoFirst
member.summary: Go to the first document.

member.name: F:C1.C1Preview.DocumentActionEnum.GoPrev
member.summary: Go to the previous document.

member.name: F:C1.C1Preview.DocumentActionEnum.GoNext
member.summary: Go to the next document.

member.name: F:C1.C1Preview.DocumentActionEnum.GoLast
member.summary: Go to the last document.

member.name: F:C1.C1Preview.DocumentActionEnum.HistoryNext
member.summary: Go to the next position in the history.

member.name: F:C1.C1Preview.DocumentActionEnum.HistoryPrev
member.summary: Go to the previous position in the history.

member.name: T:C1.C1Preview.UserActionEnum
member.summary: Identifies a single end-user input action which can be handled by a C1Preview form control.

member.name: F:C1.C1Preview.UserActionEnum.Click
member.summary: The control is clicked.

member.name: F:C1.C1Preview.UserActionEnum.MouseUp
member.summary: The mouse pointer is over the control and a mouse button is released.

member.name: F:C1.C1Preview.UserActionEnum.MouseDown
member.summary: The mouse pointer is over the control and a mouse button is pressed.

member.name: F:C1.C1Preview.UserActionEnum.MouseEnter
member.summary: The mouse pointer enters the control.

member.name: F:C1.C1Preview.UserActionEnum.MouseLeave
member.summary: The mouse pointer leaves the control.

member.name: F:C1.C1Preview.UserActionEnum.Enter
member.summary: The input focus enters the control.

member.name: F:C1.C1Preview.UserActionEnum.Leave
member.summary: The input focus leaves the control.

member.name: T:C1.C1Preview.FormsKeyActionTabEnum
member.summary: Describes the actions to be performed when the TAB key is pressed in C1PrintPreview control which is connected to the doc engine.

member.name: F:C1.C1Preview.FormsKeyActionTabEnum.MoveAccrossPage
member.summary: Focus moves to the next control on the page, but does not leave the preview nor goes to another page.

member.name: F:C1.C1Preview.FormsKeyActionTabEnum.MoveAccrossDoc
member.summary: Focus moves to the next control in the document (including across pages). Focus does not leave the preview.

member.name: F:C1.C1Preview.FormsKeyActionTabEnum.MoveAccrossPageCycle
member.summary: Focus moves to the next control on the page. When the last control is reached focus goes to the first control on the page.

member.name: F:C1.C1Preview.FormsKeyActionTabEnum.MoveAccrossDocCycle
member.summary: Focus moves to the next control in the document. When the last control is reached focus goes to the first control in the document.

member.name: F:C1.C1Preview.FormsKeyActionTabEnum.MoveAccrossPageOut
member.summary: Focus moves to the next control on the page. When the last control is reached focus goes to the next control on the form containing the preview.

member.name: F:C1.C1Preview.FormsKeyActionTabEnum.MoveAccrossDocOut
member.summary: Focus moves to the next control in the document. When the last control is reached focus goes to the next control on the form containing the preview.

member.name: T:C1.C1Preview.FormsKeyActionEnterEnum

member.name: T:C1.C1Preview.SplitBehaviorEnum
member.summary: Defines the splitting behavior of a render object.

member.name: F:C1.C1Preview.SplitBehaviorEnum.Never
member.summary: The object should not be split between pages (i.e. should always be kept together on a single page).

member.name: F:C1.C1Preview.SplitBehaviorEnum.SplitIfNeeded
member.summary: The object can be split if it does not fit onto the current page.

member.name: F:C1.C1Preview.SplitBehaviorEnum.SplitIfLarge
member.summary: The object can be split only if it is too large to fit on an empty page. In that case, the object is split immediately. Otherwise, a new page is started and the object is placed on it without splitting.

member.name: F:C1.C1Preview.SplitBehaviorEnum.SplitNewPage
member.summary: If the object does not fit on the current page (column), a new page (column) is started; if the object does not fit on that page (column), it is split as needed after that.

member.name: F:C1.C1Preview.BreakEnum.None
member.summary: No break.

member.name: F:C1.C1Preview.BreakEnum.Page
member.summary: New page should be started.

member.name: F:C1.C1Preview.BreakEnum.Column
member.summary: New column should be started.

member.name: F:C1.C1Preview.BreakEnum.Line
member.summary: New line on inline flow should be started.

member.summary: Object is visible.

member.name: F:C1.C1Preview.VisibilityEnum.Hidden
member.summary: Object is not visible, but takes up space and affects the layout of other objects as if it were visible.

member.name: F:C1.C1Preview.VisibilityEnum.Collapse
member.summary: Object is not visible, its size is zero and it does not affect the layout of other objects.

member.summary: Gets or sets value describing how the page number will be changed.

member.summary: Gets or sets the value used to change current page number, using of value depends on Mode property: set for Set, added for Increment.

member.name: T:C1.C1Preview.StackingRulesEnum
member.summary: Defines the stacking rules: block flow or inline flow, LeftToRight or TopToBottom.

member.name: F:C1.C1Preview.StackingRulesEnum.BlockTopToBottom
member.summary: Objects are placed one beneath the other within the container. When the bottom edge of the current page is reached, a new page is added. This is the default.

member.name: F:C1.C1Preview.StackingRulesEnum.BlockLeftToRight
member.summary: Objects are placed one next to another, from left to right. When the right edge of the current page is reached, a new horizontal page is added (a horizontal page logically extends the preceding page to the right; C1PreviewPane respects this location by default, showing such pages in a row).

member.name: F:C1.C1Preview.StackingRulesEnum.InlineLeftToRight
member.summary: Objects are placed inline, one next to another, from left to right. When the right edge of the current page is reached, the sequence wraps to the next line. A new page is added when the bottom of the current page is reached.

member.name: P:C1.C1Preview.C1Hyperlink.LinkTarget
member.summary: Determines the target of the hyperlink.

remarks.para: The hyperlink target is described by an instance of a class derived from , and can be of one of the following types:

item.description: An anchor defined within the current document.
A location within the the current document.
An anchor defined within a previously saved C1D document.
An external document, program or URL. The ShellExecute API is used to invoke the link.
A page within the current document.
The hyperlink target is determined by a user event handler.

member.summary: All pages of the document are in the range.

member.summary: Pages that are in the range are specified as a list.

member.summary: One or more ranges of pages are specified.

member.name: T:C1.C1Preview.OutputRange
member.summary: Describes a part of the document (pages or objects) that is to be exported or printed. Note: all page numbers are 1-based sequential numbers.

member.summary: If included in the page indices list, specifies that all pages from preceeding to the next one are to be included in the output.

member.name: F:C1.C1Preview.OutputRange.NoPage
member.summary: This value indicates an invalid page number.

member.name: M:C1.C1Preview.OutputRange.#ctor
member.summary: Creates a new instance of the output range that includes all pages in the document. Note that enumerating the resulting range must be broken by the client.

member.name: M:C1.C1Preview.OutputRange.#ctor(System.Int32)
member.summary: Creates a new instance of the output range that includes all pages in the document.
member.param: The maximum page number (used to prevent infinite enumeration).

member.name: M:C1.C1Preview.OutputRange.#ctor(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Creates an instance of OutputRange that includes a single interval of pages. FromPage may be greater than ToPage, in that case the range is inverted.
member.param: The number of the first page to include (1-based).
The number of the last page to include (1-based).

member.name: M:C1.C1Preview.OutputRange.#ctor(System.Int32[])
member.summary: Creates an instance of OutputRange that includes all pages with numbers specified in the list. The list may include Dash values to specify intervals.
member.param: The array of page numbers to include.

member.name: M:C1.C1Preview.OutputRange.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Creates an instance of OutputRange that includes pages specified by the string parameter. The string may contain: - page numbers (1-based) separated by spaces or commas; - dashes ('-') to specify intervals (a dash at the end implies infinity).
member.param: The pages to be included.

member.summary: Copies values from another instance of OutputRange.
member.param: The OutputRange to copy values from.

member.summary: Clones the current OutputRange.

member.summary: Returns a string that represents the current OutputRange.
member.returns: A string that represents the range.

member.summary: Returns the page number in the range following the specified one, or -1 if the specified number was the last one.

member.returns: The next page number or -1 if there's none.

member.summary: Returns the page number in the range following the specified one, or -1 if the specified number was the last one.

A cookie used to avoid infinite loops in cases where the same page number appears in several ranges. Set this value to 0 before the first call to this method.

member.name: T:C1.C1Preview.RefreshModeEnum
member.summary: Describes the data and expressions refresh mode during document generation.

member.name: F:C1.C1Preview.RefreshModeEnum.NoRefresh
member.summary: Neither expressions nor data are refreshed. Note that if the document has not yet been generated, this mode is ignored (i.e. data is refreshed and expressions are calculated).

member.name: F:C1.C1Preview.RefreshModeEnum.RefreshDataBinding
member.summary: Data is refreshed, all expressions are recalculated.

member.name: F:C1.C1Preview.RefreshModeEnum.RefreshCalculatedValues
member.summary: Expressions that do not reference data sources are recalculated, but data is not refreshed. Note that if the document has not yet been generated, this mode is ignored (i.e. data is refreshed).

member.name: T:C1.C1Preview.RefDim
member.summary:
Internal, describes the dimensions of object.
Left, Top, Right, Bottom - Absolute coordinates on page.
RelLeft, RelTop, RelRight, RelBottom - Relative coordinates in parent.
ChildLeft, ChildTop, ChildRight, ChildBottom - Relative coordinates for child objects, ChildLeft and ChildTop are always 0, ChildRight = Width - SpacingLeft - SpacingRight - PaddingLeft - PaddingRight - BordersLeft - BordersRight
Width, Height - sizes of object.
ChildWidth, ChildHeight - sizes for child objects, for example, ChildWidth is Width - (SpacingLeft + BorderLeft + PaddingLeft) - (SpacingRight + BorderRight + PaddingRight).
